area.title: Area Converter
area.description: Convert between different area units like square meters, hectares, acres, and more.
area.info_desc: A useful tool for converting land, real estate, and geometric areas.

howItWorks.title: How the Area Converter Works
howItWorks.description: The area converter uses square meters as the base unit for all conversions. When you enter a value in any unit, it's first converted to square meters, then to your target unit.
steps: Enter the numerical area value
Select the source unit (the unit you're converting from)
Select the target unit (the unit you're converting to)
Get your result instantly with high precision

items.title: Real Estate & Property
items.description: Convert land areas between hectares, acres, and square meters when buying or selling property

items.title: Construction & Renovation
items.description: Calculate tile, paint, and flooring quantities based on room dimensions

items.title: Agriculture & Farming
items.description: Convert farm and field areas to calculate seed and fertilizer requirements

items.title: Engineering & Design
items.description: Convert area units in architectural and engineering blueprints

seoTips.title: Tips for Optimal Use
tips: Use hectares for large agricultural areas and acres for land
Square meters are ideal for homes, apartments, and rooms
Square kilometers are used for cities and large geographic regions
Always verify your unit selection before converting to avoid errors

mistakes.correction: Meters measure length while square meters measure area (length x width)

mistakes.mistake: Using US acres instead of local units
mistakes.correction: The US acre differs from other regional land units; verify which unit is used in your area

mistakes.mistake: Forgetting to square the conversion factor
mistakes.correction: When converting area units, you must square the linear conversion factor

items.question: How many square meters are in a hectare?
items.answer: One hectare equals 10,000 square meters, which is equivalent to a square 100 meters on each side.

items.question: What's the difference between an acre and a hectare?
items.answer: One hectare equals approximately 2.47 acres. Hectares are the metric standard internationally, while acres are common in the US and UK.

items.question: How do I calculate room area in square meters?
items.answer: Multiply the room's length in meters by its width in meters. Example: a 4m x 5m room = 20 square meters.

items.question: What's the best unit to measure apartment size?
items.answer: Square meters or square feet are most commonly used for apartments and houses, depending on your country's standards.

temperature.title: Temperature Converter
temperature.description: Convert between Celsius, Fahrenheit, and Kelvin temperature scales.
temperature.info_desc: Easily convert temperatures for scientific, weather, and cooking purposes.

howItWorks.title: How the Temperature Converter Works
howItWorks.description: The converter uses precise mathematical formulas to convert between temperature scales. Each scale has different zero points and degree sizes.
steps: Enter the temperature value you want to convert
Select the current temperature scale (Celsius, Fahrenheit, or Kelvin)
Select the target scale you want to convert to
Get the result along with the formula used

items.title: Cooking & Baking
items.description: Convert oven temperatures between American recipes (Fahrenheit) and international ones (Celsius)

items.title: Weather & Climate
items.description: Understand temperature readings from international weather reports that may use different scales

items.title: Scientific Experiments
items.description: Convert to Kelvin for physics and chemistry calculations

items.title: Travel
items.description: Understand weather forecasts when traveling to countries using Fahrenheit

seoTips.title: Tips for Optimal Use
tips: Celsius is used in most countries worldwide
Fahrenheit is primarily used in the United States
Kelvin starts from absolute zero and cannot be negative
When cooking, always verify the oven temperature unit in your recipe

mistakes.mistake: Confusing Celsius and Fahrenheit in recipes
mistakes.correction: Always check the temperature unit specified - 350°F equals approximately 175°C
Kelvin cannot be negative as it starts from absolute zero

mistakes.mistake: Assuming one degree change is equal across all scales
mistakes.correction: One Celsius degree equals 1.8 Fahrenheit degrees

items.question: What is normal body temperature in Fahrenheit?
items.answer: Normal body temperature of 37°C equals 98.6°F in Fahrenheit.

items.question: At what temperature does water boil in Fahrenheit?
items.answer: Water boils at 100°C, which equals 212°F at sea level.

items.question: What is absolute zero?
items.answer: Absolute zero is 0 Kelvin or -273.15°C, the theoretically lowest possible temperature.

items.question: Why do scientists use the Kelvin scale?
items.answer: Because Kelvin starts from absolute zero, making it suitable for physics calculations and thermodynamic equations.

volume.title: Volume Converter
volume.description: Convert between different volume units like liters, gallons, and cubic meters.
volume.info_desc: Essential tool for converting cooking measurements, liquids, and tank volumes.
volume.from_tooltip: Select volume unit to convert from
volume.to_tooltip: Select volume unit to convert to
volume.formula_desc: All conversions use Liter as the base unit for accuracy.

howItWorks.title: How the Volume Converter Works
howItWorks.description: The converter uses liters as the base unit for all conversions. Your input value is first converted to liters, then to your target unit for accuracy.
steps: Enter the volume value you want to convert
Select the current volume unit from the dropdown
Select the unit you want to convert to
Get the precise result instantly

items.title: Cooking & Recipes
items.description: Convert international recipe measurements from cups and ounces to milliliters and grams

items.title: Fuel Tanks
items.description: Calculate car tank capacity and convert between liters and gallons

items.title: Medicine & Dosages
items.description: Convert liquid medication doses between milliliters and tablespoons

items.title: Engineering Projects
items.description: Calculate tank, pool, and basin volumes in cubic meters

seoTips.title: Tips for Optimal Use
tips: Liters and milliliters are the most common volume units globally
US gallons differ from Imperial (UK) gallons
One tablespoon equals approximately 15 milliliters
One cubic meter equals 1,000 liters

mistakes.correction: US gallon = 3.785 liters, while Imperial gallon = 4.546 liters

mistakes.mistake: Using regular cups instead of measuring cups
mistakes.correction: A US measuring cup = 236 mL; always use standardized measuring tools
Cubic centimeters equal milliliters exactly (1 cm³ = 1 mL)

items.question: How many liters are in a gallon?
items.answer: A US gallon equals approximately 3.785 liters, while an Imperial gallon equals 4.546 liters.

items.question: How many milliliters are in a cup?
items.answer: A standard US cup equals approximately 236.6 milliliters.

items.question: What's the difference between a liter and a cubic meter?
items.answer: One cubic meter equals 1,000 liters. Liters are typically used for liquids while cubic meters for larger volumes.

items.question: How many tablespoons are in a cup?
items.answer: A US cup contains approximately 16 tablespoons.

speed.title: Speed Converter
speed.description: Convert between speed units like km/h, mph, and knots.
speed.info_desc: Convert between different speed units for transportation, sports, and weather.
speed.formula_desc: All conversions use meters per second as the base unit for accuracy.

howItWorks.title: How the Speed Converter Works
howItWorks.description: The converter uses meters per second as the base unit. Input speeds are converted to m/s first, then to your target unit.
steps: Enter the speed value you want to convert
Select the current speed unit
Select the unit you want to convert to
Get the precise result instantly

items.title: Driving & Automobiles
items.description: Convert car speeds between km/h and mph when renting a car abroad

items.title: Maritime Navigation
items.description: Convert ship speeds from knots to km/h to understand distances and travel times

items.title: Aviation
items.description: Understand aircraft speeds given in knots or Mach numbers

items.title: Sports & Running
items.description: Convert running and cycling speeds between different units

seoTips.title: Tips for Optimal Use
tips: km/h is used in most countries worldwide
mph is used in the US and UK
Knots are the standard unit in maritime and aviation navigation
Quick conversion: 1 mph ≈ 1.6 km/h

mistakes.mistake: Confusing statute miles with nautical miles
mistakes.correction: Statute mile = 1.609 km, while nautical mile = 1.852 km
One knot = 1.852 km/h, they are not equal

mistakes.mistake: Ignoring wind effects on actual speed
mistakes.correction: In aviation and navigation, ground speed differs from airspeed due to wind

items.question: How many kilometers per hour is one mile per hour?
items.answer: 1 mph equals approximately 1.609 km/h.

items.question: What is a knot and why is it used at sea?
items.answer: A knot is one nautical mile per hour (1.852 km/h). It's used in navigation because it directly relates to longitude lines on charts.

items.question: What is the speed of sound?
items.answer: The speed of sound at sea level is approximately 343 m/s or 1,235 km/h (Mach 1).

items.question: How do I convert from km/h to m/s?
items.answer: Divide by 3.6. Example: 90 km/h ÷ 3.6 = 25 m/s.

time.title: Time Converter
time.description: Convert between time units from seconds to years.
time.info_desc: Convert between different time units for scheduling and time calculations.
time.from_tooltip: Select the time unit to convert from
time.to_tooltip: Select the time unit to convert to
time.formula_desc: All conversions use Second as the base unit for accuracy.

howItWorks.title: How the Time Converter Works
howItWorks.description: The converter uses seconds as the base unit. Input time values are converted to seconds first, then to your target unit.
steps: Enter the time value you want to convert
Select the current time unit (second, minute, hour, etc.)
Select the unit you want to convert to
Get the precise result directly

items.title: Project Management
items.description: Convert work hours to days and weeks for project planning

items.title: Programming & Development
items.description: Convert milliseconds to seconds and minutes for application performance measurement

items.title: Travel & Trips
items.description: Calculate trip durations and convert hours to days

items.title: Financial Calculations
items.description: Convert loan and investment periods between months and years

seoTips.title: Tips for Optimal Use
tips: Month is calculated as an average of 30.44 days for accuracy
Year is calculated as 365.25 days to account for leap years
Use milliseconds to measure software and game performance
A week is always exactly 7 days

mistakes.correction: Months range from 28-31 days; the converter uses the average of 30.44 days
Leap years have 366 days and occur approximately every 4 years

mistakes.mistake: Confusing business days with calendar days
mistakes.correction: A work week is typically 5 days while a calendar week is 7 days

items.question: How many seconds are in a year?
items.answer: A regular year contains 31,536,000 seconds (365 days × 24 hours × 60 minutes × 60 seconds).

items.question: How many hours are in a month?
items.answer: With an average of 30.44 days per month, there are approximately 730.5 hours in a month.

items.question: What is a millisecond?
items.answer: A millisecond is one-thousandth of a second (0.001 seconds). It's used in computing and performance measurement.

items.question: How many weeks are in a year?
items.answer: A year contains approximately 52.18 weeks (365 days ÷ 7 days).

data_storage.title: Data Storage Converter
data_storage.description: Convert between bits, bytes, kilobytes, megabytes, etc.
data_storage.info_desc: Convert between different data storage units for file sizes, disk space, and memory.
data_storage.from_tooltip: Select data unit to convert from
data_storage.to_tooltip: Select data unit to convert to
data_storage.binary_desc: Used by most operating systems (1 KB = 1024 bytes)
data_storage.decimal_desc: Used by hard drive manufacturers (1 KB = 1000 bytes)
data_storage.formula_desc: Conversion depends on whether binary (1024) or decimal (1000) mode is selected.

howItWorks.title: How the Data Storage Converter Works
howItWorks.description: The converter supports two modes: Binary (1024) used by operating systems, and Decimal (1000) used by drive manufacturers.
steps: Enter the data value you want to convert
Select the current data unit
Select the unit you want to convert to
Choose the conversion mode (binary or decimal)
Get the precise result

items.title: File Management
items.description: Know file sizes in different units to organize storage

items.title: Buying Storage Devices
items.description: Understand actual hard drive capacity and compare options

items.title: Uploading & Downloading
items.description: Calculate download time based on internet speed and file size

items.title: Backup Planning
items.description: Estimate storage space needed for data backups

seoTips.title: Tips for Optimal Use
tips: Binary mode (1024) gives results matching what your operating system shows
Decimal mode (1000) gives results matching what drive manufacturers advertise
One byte equals 8 bits
1 GB (binary) = 1,073,741,824 bytes

mistakes.correction: A 1 TB drive shows as 931 GB on your computer due to the difference between systems
Internet speed is measured in megabits (Mb) while file sizes use megabytes (MB)
KB can mean 1000 or 1024 bytes depending on context

items.question: Why does my hard drive show less capacity than advertised?
items.answer: Because manufacturers use decimal (1 GB = 1000 MB) while operating systems use binary (1 GB = 1024 MB).

items.question: What's the difference between Mb and MB?
items.answer: Mb (megabit) = million bits, MB (megabyte) = million bytes. Megabytes are 8 times larger.

items.question: How many photos can I store in 1 GB?
items.answer: It depends on photo quality. Phone photos (3-5 MB) allow approximately 200-300 photos per gigabyte.

items.question: What is a petabyte?
items.answer: Petabyte = 1000 terabytes (decimal) or 1024 terabytes (binary). It's used to measure massive data center storage.

pressure.title: Pressure Converter
pressure.description: Convert between pressure units like Bar, Pascal, and PSI.
pressure.info_desc: Convert between different pressure units for scientific, engineering, and weather applications.
pressure.from_tooltip: Select pressure unit to convert from
pressure.to_tooltip: Select pressure unit to convert to
pressure.formula_desc: All conversions use Pascal as the base unit for accuracy.

howItWorks.title: How the Pressure Converter Works
howItWorks.description: The converter uses Pascal as the base unit for all conversions. Pascal is the SI unit for pressure measurement.
steps: Enter the pressure value you want to convert
Select the current pressure unit
Select the unit you want to convert to
Get the high-precision result

items.title: Automotive Maintenance
items.description: Measure and convert car tire pressure between PSI and Bar

items.title: Weather & Meteorology
items.description: Convert atmospheric pressure readings between mmHg and hectopascals

items.title: Scuba Diving
items.description: Calculate water pressure at different depths in atmospheres and bars

items.title: Industrial Systems
items.description: Convert pressure units in hydraulic and pneumatic systems

seoTips.title: Tips for Optimal Use
tips: Bar is common in Europe and many countries for tire pressure
PSI is common in the US and UK
Standard atmospheric pressure = 1 atm = 101.325 kPa = 1.013 bar
mmHg is used in medicine for blood pressure measurement

mistakes.correction: Gauge pressure is measured from atmospheric pressure, while absolute is from complete vacuum

mistakes.mistake: Using PSI instead of Bar in certain regions
mistakes.correction: Most tire pumps outside the US use Bar units
1 mbar = 0.75 mmHg approximately, they are not equal

items.question: What is normal atmospheric pressure?
items.answer: Normal atmospheric pressure at sea level = 1 atm = 101.325 kPa = 1.013 bar = 760 mmHg.

items.question: What PSI should car tires be?
items.answer: Typically 30-35 PSI (2.0-2.4 bar) for regular cars. Check your vehicle manual for exact values.

items.question: What's the relationship between mmHg and Torr?
items.answer: They are approximately equal. 1 Torr = 1 mmHg under certain conditions.

items.question: Why is mmHg used for blood pressure?
items.answer: For historical reasons, early blood pressure devices used mercury columns, and the unit persisted for standardization.

force.title: Force Converter
force.description: Convert between force units like Newton and Pound-force.
force.info_desc: Convert between different force units for physics and engineering applications.
force.from_tooltip: Select force unit to convert from
force.to_tooltip: Select force unit to convert to
force.formula_desc: All conversions use Newton as the base unit for accuracy.

howItWorks.title: How the Force Converter Works
howItWorks.description: The converter uses Newton as the base unit for all conversions. Newton is the SI unit for force measurement.
steps: Enter the force value you want to convert
Select the current force unit
Select the unit you want to convert to
Get the precise result instantly

items.title: Structural Engineering
items.description: Calculate loads and forces in building and bridge design

items.title: Physics & Mechanics
items.description: Apply Newton's laws and calculate forces in physics problems

items.title: Automotive Industry
items.description: Measure engine power and torque in various units

items.title: Materials Testing
items.description: Measure tensile and compressive forces in material tests

seoTips.title: Tips for Optimal Use
tips: Newton is the international standard SI unit for force
1 kilogram-force ≈ 9.81 Newtons (weight of 1 kg on Earth)
Pound-force is common in the United States
Dyne is a very small unit used in theoretical physics

mistakes.correction: Mass (kg) is constant, while weight (Newtons) depends on gravity

mistakes.mistake: Using kilogram as a force unit
mistakes.correction: Kilogram is a mass unit; use kilogram-force (kgf) or Newton for force

mistakes.mistake: Forgetting that g varies by location
mistakes.correction: Gravitational acceleration varies slightly by location (9.78-9.83 m/s²)

items.question: What is a Newton?
items.answer: A Newton is the force required to accelerate a 1 kg mass at 1 m/s². Named after Isaac Newton.

items.question: How many Newtons equal one kilogram-force?
items.answer: 1 kilogram-force = 9.80665 Newtons (using standard g).

items.question: What's the difference between force and pressure?
items.answer: Force is a push or pull (in Newtons), while pressure is force divided by area (in Pascals).

items.question: When should I use kilonewtons?
items.answer: For large forces in structural engineering. 1 kilonewton = 1000 Newtons ≈ 102 kgf.

currency.title: Currency Converter
currency.description: Quick and easy conversion between major world and Arabic currencies.
currency.info_desc: Convert between major global currencies like USD, EUR, and JPY, as well as Arabic currencies like SAR, AED, and EGP.
currency.static_rates_notice: Note: Using static exchange rates. For real-time rates, consider using official sources.
currency.disclaimer: Exchange rates are for reference only and may not reflect real-time market rates.

howItWorks.description: The converter uses reference exchange rates to convert between currencies. The amount is multiplied by the exchange rate to get the equivalent value.
steps: Enter the amount you want to convert
Select the source currency (the currency you have)
Select the target currency (the currency you want)
Get the result along with the exchange rate used

items.title: Travel Planning
items.description: Calculate trip costs in local currency before traveling

items.title: Online Shopping
items.description: Know the real price of products on international websites

items.title: Money Transfers
items.description: Estimate the amount the recipient will receive after transfer

items.title: Investment
items.description: Track the value of investments in foreign currencies

seoTips.title: Tips for Optimal Use
tips: Displayed rates are for reference only; check with your bank for actual rates
Banks add a profit margin on top of official exchange rates
Best conversion times are usually during market hours
Compare multiple sources to get the best rate

mistakes.mistake: Relying on a single exchange rate for planning
mistakes.correction: Exchange rates fluctuate constantly; calculate with a 5-10% safety margin
Banks and transfer companies charge additional fees on top of the exchange rate
Airport exchange offices typically offer the worst rates

items.question: Are the exchange rates in the converter accurate?
items.answer: Rates are for reference only and may differ from live market rates. Check with a bank or exchange office for actual rates.

items.question: Why is the buy rate different from the sell rate?
items.answer: Banks buy currency at a lower price and sell at a higher price. The difference is their profit margin.

items.question: What's the best way to get foreign currency?
items.answer: Compare banks, exchange offices, and travel cards. Banks usually offer better rates than airports.

items.question: Is the Saudi Riyal pegged to the US Dollar?
items.answer: Yes, the Saudi Riyal is pegged to the US Dollar at approximately 3.75 SAR per USD.

weight.title: Weight Converter
weight.description: Convert between different weight and mass units.
weight.info_desc: Convert between kilograms, pounds, ounces, grams, and more.
weight.formula_desc: All conversions use Kilogram as the base unit for accuracy.

howItWorks.title: How the Weight Converter Works

steps: Enter the weight value you want to convert

items.title: Cooking & Recipes
items.description: Convert recipe measurements between grams, ounces, and pounds

items.title: Shipping & Postage
items.description: Calculate package weights for international shipping

items.title: Health & Fitness
items.description: Convert body weight between kilograms and pounds

items.title: Jewelry
items.description: Convert gemstone weights between carats and grams

seoTips.title: Tips for Optimal Use
tips: Kilogram is the standard unit in most countries
Pounds and ounces are common in the US and UK
Carats are used for weighing diamonds and gemstones
1 pound = 453.6 grams approximately

mistakes.correction: Metric ton = 1000 kg, US ton = 907 kg
The US ounce = 28.35 grams; it differs from traditional regional ounces
Mass is constant while weight changes with gravity

items.question: How many grams are in a pound?
items.answer: One pound equals approximately 453.592 grams.

items.question: What is a Stone?
items.answer: Stone is a British unit equal to 14 pounds or about 6.35 kilograms. It's used for body weight in the UK.

items.question: How many carats are in a gram?
items.answer: One gram equals 5 carats. One carat = 0.2 grams and is used for gemstones.

items.question: What's the difference between kg and kgf?
items.answer: kg (kilogram) is a mass unit, while kgf (kilogram-force) is a force unit. 1 kgf is the weight of 1 kg on Earth.

length.title: Length Converter
length.info_desc: Convert between meters, feet, inches, kilometers, miles, and more.
length.formula_desc: All conversions use Meter as the base unit for accuracy.

howItWorks.description: The converter uses meter as the base unit for all conversions. Input lengths are converted to meters first, then to your target unit.
steps: Enter the length value you want to convert
Select the current length unit
Select the unit you want to convert to
Get the precise result instantly

items.title: Construction & Building
items.description: Convert measurements in engineering blueprints between meters and feet

items.title: Travel & Navigation
items.description: Convert distances between kilometers and miles for trip planning

items.title: Electronics
items.description: Screen and device measurements in inches and centimeters

items.title: Sewing & Fabrics
items.description: Convert clothing measurements between different systems

seoTips.title: Tips for Optimal Use
tips: Meters and centimeters are common in most countries
Inches and feet are common in the US and used for screen sizes
Nautical miles are used in maritime and aviation navigation
1 inch = 2.54 cm exactly

mistakes.correction: Statute mile = 1.609 km, nautical mile = 1.852 km

mistakes.mistake: Using square feet instead of feet
mistakes.correction: Feet is a length unit, square feet is an area unit
Inches = 2.54 cm exactly; rounding may cause cumulative errors

items.question: How many centimeters are in an inch?
items.answer: One inch equals exactly 2.54 centimeters.

items.question: How many kilometers are in a mile?
items.answer: One mile equals 1.609344 kilometers.

items.question: What is a nautical mile?
items.answer: A nautical mile = 1.852 km. It's used in navigation because it equals one minute of latitude.

items.question: How do I convert my height from cm to feet and inches?
items.answer: Divide by 2.54 to get inches, then divide by 12 for feet. Example: 175 cm = 68.9 inches = 5 feet 8.9 inches.

number_system.description: Convert between number systems (Binary, Octal, Decimal, Hexadecimal).

items.title: Programming
items.description: Convert binary and hexadecimal numbers in programming code

items.title: Networking
items.description: Convert IP addresses and subnet masks

items.title: Colors
items.description: Convert hexadecimal color codes (like #FF0000)

items.title: Electronics
items.description: Understand resistor values and digital data

seoTips.title: Tips for Optimal Use
tips: Binary uses only 0 and 1
Octal uses 0-7
Hexadecimal uses 0-9 and A-F
0x before a number indicates hexadecimal in programming

mistakes.mistake: Using invalid digits for a system
mistakes.correction: Binary only accepts 0 and 1; octal accepts 0-7
In hexadecimal, A-F and a-f are equivalent (A=a=10)
In programming: 0b for binary, 0o for octal, 0x for hexadecimal

items.question: Why do computers use binary?
items.answer: Because electronic circuits have only two states: on (1) and off (0), making binary the most suitable system.

items.question: What's the relationship between hexadecimal and colors?
items.answer: Color codes like #FF0000 are three hexadecimal values (red, green, blue), each ranging from 00-FF.

items.question: How do I manually convert binary to decimal?
items.answer: Multiply each digit by 2 raised to its position from right (starting at 0) and sum the results. Example: 1010 = 1×8 + 0×4 + 1×2 + 0×1 = 10

items.question: What's the importance of octal?
items.answer: It's used in Linux file permissions (like 755) and some legacy applications because it's easier to read than binary.
